fast3d.util

Class AVec

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.util.AVec

  • public class AVec
extends java.lang.Object
    a very simple call providing the basics to simulate accelerated movement
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Vector3d acceleration
      the current oriented accumulation of applied forces
      double mass
      the mass of what is to move (the higher the mass, the less strong forces result in speed) - only for new added forces
      double maximumAcceleration
      the maximum length of the acceleration vector
      double maximumVelocity
      the maximum length of the velocity vector
      Vector3d position
      the location of what is to be moved
      Vector3d velocity
      the current oriented speed

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AVec()
      constructs a new accelerated movement at position (0,0,0) with mass 1 standing still
      AVec(double mass)
      constructs a new accelerated movement at position (0,0,0) standing still
      AVec(Vector3d position)
      constructs a new accelerated movement with mass of 1d standing still
      AVec(Vector3d position, double mass)
      constructs a new accelerated movement standing still

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void applyAcceleration(Vector3d acceleration)
      adds the acceleration not considering the mass of this
      void applyForce(Vector3d force)
      adds the force to what is to move
      void changeMass(double nm)
      changes the mass of this considering it's acceleration
      void resetForces()
      sets acceleration to zero
      void update(FrameRate fr)
      should be called every frame to apply changes to the position and velocity

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • position

        the location of what is to be moved

        the current oriented speed

      • acceleration

        public final Vector3d acceleration
        the current oriented accumulation of applied forces

      • mass

        public double mass
        the mass of what is to move (the higher the mass, the less strong forces result in speed) - only for new added forces

      • maximumAcceleration

        public double maximumAcceleration
        the maximum length of the acceleration vector

      • maximumVelocity

        public double maximumVelocity
        the maximum length of the velocity vector

    • Constructor Detail

      • AVec

        public AVec()
        constructs a new accelerated movement at position (0,0,0) with mass 1 standing still

      • AVec

        public AVec(double mass)
        constructs a new accelerated movement at position (0,0,0) standing still
        Parameters:
        mass - the mass field data

      • AVec

        public AVec(Vector3d position)
        constructs a new accelerated movement with mass of 1d standing still
        Parameters:
        position - where to be initially

      • AVec

        public AVec(Vector3d position,
            double mass)
        constructs a new accelerated movement standing still
        Parameters:
        position - where to be initially
        mass - the mass field data

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(FrameRate fr)
        should be called every frame to apply changes to the position and velocity
        Parameters:
        fr - information about how long a frame last

      • applyForce

        public void applyForce(Vector3d force)
        adds the force to what is to move
        Parameters:
        force - direction and strength (length) of the pulling force

      • resetForces

        public void resetForces()
        sets acceleration to zero

      • applyAcceleration

        public void applyAcceleration(Vector3d acceleration)
        adds the acceleration not considering the mass of this
        Parameters:
        acceleration - a vector to add to this.acceleration

      • changeMass

        public void changeMass(double nm)
        changes the mass of this considering it's acceleration
        Parameters:
        nm - the new mass
